meanings.definition: Outlivers (verb): to live longer than someone or something else
meanings.sent1: My great-grandmother outlivers all her friends.
meanings.sent2: The tortoise outlivers the hare in the famous race.
meanings.sent3: The ancient tree outlivers the new saplings in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The old lighthouse outlivers the storms that rage against it.
meanings.sent5: The wise owl outlivers the changing seasons with its wisdom.

meanings.definition: Outlivers (noun): someone who lives longer than others
meanings.sent1: The outlivers in the family are always celebrated on their birthdays.
meanings.sent2: The oldest tortoise in the zoo is considered an outlivers.
meanings.sent3: The outlivers at the retirement home have many stories to tell.
meanings.sent4: The outlivers of the group are often sought for advice.
meanings.sent5: The outlivers in the village are respected for their longevity.

meanings.definition: Outlivers (adjective): describing someone or something that has lived longer than expected
meanings.sent1: The outlivers cat surprised everyone with its age.
meanings.sent2: The outlivers oak tree stood tall in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The outlivers clock in the town square never seems to stop ticking.
meanings.sent4: The outlivers building in the city holds many memories within its walls.
meanings.sent5: The outlivers mountain range is a testament to the passage of time.
